alert.note: Alert for Logan; Polk; Scott; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 31 at 10:59PM CST until January 01 at 1:50AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Yell County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Logan County in western Arkansas... Northern Polk County in western Arkansas... Southeastern Scott County in western Arkansas... * Until 150 AM CST. * At 1059 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area with more storms expected to move into the area from the southwest. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have already fallen, and it will not take much more rainfall to cause local flash flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Russellville, Mena, Danville, Dardanelle, Hatfield, Cardiff, Gravelly, Stonehouse Recreation Area, Fourche Valley, Mena Intermountain Airport, Polk County Fairgrounds, Queen Wilhelmina State Park, Mountain Fork, Mosley, Mt Nebo State Park, Lake Dardanelle, Lake Dardanelle State Park, Belleville, Cove and Havana. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
